com.hdcookbook.grin.animator
Class RenderArea

java.lang.Object
  com.hdcookbook.grin.animator.RenderArea

public class RenderArea
extends java.lang.Object

A RenderArea represents a rectangular area of the screen that will be rendered to in the current frame of animation. The animation manager provides its animation clients with a set of render areas, so that they can indicate where they plan to draw. After that's done, it's OK if the RenderArea instances represent overlapping areas. Before drawing, the animation manager might collapse some of the render areas together, in order to optimize the amount of drawing that has to be done.

Method Detail

getBounds

public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
Give the bounds to be drawn for this render area. The width will be -1 if nothing is to be drawn.

addArea

public void addArea(java.awt.Rectangle area)
Add the given area to this render area, so that the animation manager will cause this area of the screen to be drawn to. The given area will not be erased, so the caller must ensure that every pixel within the given area is drawn to.

This is equivalent to addArea(area.x, area.y, area.width, area.height)

clearAndAddArea

public void clearAndAddArea(java.awt.Rectangle area)
Add the given area to this render area, so that the animation manager will cause this area of the screen to be drawn to. The given area will be erased by the animation manager, before any animation client is asked to draw to it. In this way, it's OK for the animation client to do SrcOver drawing to this area, or drawing that doesn't fill every pixel in the given area.

This is equivalent to clearAndddArea(area.x, area.y, area.width, area.height)

addArea

public void addArea(int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
Add the given area to this render area, so that the animation manager will cause this area of the screen to be drawn to. The given area will not be erased, so the caller must ensure that every pixel within the given area is drawn to.

clearAndAddArea

public void clearAndAddArea(int x,
                            int y,
                            int width,
                            int height)
Add the given area to this render area, so that the animation manager will cause this area of the screen to be drawn to. The given area will be erased by the animation manager, before any animation client is asked to draw to it. In this way, it's OK for the animation client to do SrcOver drawing to this area, or drawing that doesn't fill every pixel in the given area.
